column1:
5.2.4.3	
Guidelines for MRI imaging in biopsy decision
When MRI is positive (i.e., PI-RADS > 3), combine targeted and systematic biopsy.

When MRI is negative (i.e., PI-RADS < 2), and clinical suspicion of PCa is low (e.g., PSA 
density < 0.15 ng/mL), omit biopsy based on shared decision-making with the patient.
